data.title: The Great Gatsby
data.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
data.summary: A novel about the American dream and the disillusionment of the Jazz Age.

data.author: George Orwell
data.summary: A totalitarian regime that uses surveillance and propaganda to control every aspect of life.

data.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
data.author: Harper Lee
data.summary: A gripping, heart-wrenching novel about racism and injustice in the American South.

data.title: Moby-Dick
data.author: Herman Melville
data.summary: The story of a sea captain's obsessive quest to hunt the giant white whale, Moby Dick.

data.title: Pride and Prejudice
data.author: Jane Austen
data.summary: A romantic novel that critiques the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.

data.title: The Catcher in the Rye
data.author: J.D. Salinger
data.summary: A young man's reflections on life, love, and his own struggles with adolescence and identity.

data.title: The Hobbit
data.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
data.summary: The story of a hobbit's adventure to reclaim treasure guarded by a fearsome dragon.

data.title: Brave New World
data.author: Aldous Huxley
data.summary: A futuristic society where technology controls everything, and individuality is suppressed.

data.title: War and Peace
data.author: Leo Tolstoy
data.summary: A sweeping novel that explores Russian society during the Napoleonic wars.

data.title: The Odyssey
data.author: Homer
data.summary: The epic journey of Odysseus as he attempts to return home from the Trojan War.
